message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This report leverages data from the Global Financial Inclusion Database and the World Bank's Enterprise Survey to examine the relationship between financial inclusion and firm performance in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion Database", "World Bank's Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using a nationally representative household survey dataset, we find that increases in food prices are associated with significant decreases in caloric intake and undernutrition prevalence among children in rural areas of Tanzania.", "dataset": ["nationally representative household survey dataset"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Our study links a new global dataset on disaster risk reduction investment, Geo-referenced Infrastructure and Demographic Data for Development (GRID3) and damage assessments from six recent disasters in Ethiopia, Nepal and the Philippines to estimate efficacy and cost-effectiveness measures.", "dataset": ["Geo-referenced Infrastructure and Demographic Data for Development (GRID3)"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "We use data on tax incentives for private companies and public goods spending across 85 countries over a period of 50 years to study the impact of tax incentives on economic development.", "dataset": ["data on tax incentives"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "To estimate the causal effect of transport infrastructure on urban development, we exploit the staggered implementation of India's flagship program for urbanization launched in 2005, Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission (JNNURM), using detailed data on city-level infrastructure and institutional characteristics from India's Census of Local Bodies.", "dataset": ["India's Census of Local Bodies"], "topic": ["Transport", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "Combining information on school feeding program implementation dates, budget, and coverage with household expenditure surveys, we evaluate the impact of Brazil's National School Feeding Programme on food consumption and child health outcomes in highly vulnerable municipalities.", "dataset": ["household expenditure surveys"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We use administrative data on poverty-targeted cash transfers coupled with satellite data on precipitation and vegetation index to explore the role of environmental factors in long-term poverty reduction in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["administrative data on poverty-targeted cash transfers"], "topic": ["Environment", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We combine the Indonesia Family Life Survey (IFLS) and exploratory interviews held in 2014 with members of selected households from the Banjar district of South Kalimantan province to study healthcare utilization patterns at the sub-national level.", "dataset": ["Indonesia Family Life Survey (IFLS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we merge data from the World Bank’s Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA), household budget surveys, and nutrition data from Demographic Health Surveys to assess the nexus between rural livelihoods, dietary diversity, and nutrition outcomes in Uganda.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)", "Demographic Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using high-frequency mobile phone data, transaction data, and bank account balance data, we study the effects of India's demonetization exercise on digital payment adoption and usage patterns among low-income households.", "dataset": ["high-frequency mobile phone data", "transaction data", "bank account balance data"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis draws on administrative tax records, firm-level surveys conducted by the World Bank, and a novel dataset on Brazilian port performance to assess the impact of trade liberalization on firm-level productivity in Brazil.", "dataset": ["administrative tax records", "firm-level surveys conducted by the World Bank", "Brazilian port performance"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Trade"]}]
